docs.lead_paragraph: Adolescents . . . want to discuss the issues on an adult-to-adult basis. If the argument comes out a draw, though, the parent shouldn't be so scrupulously democratic that he assumes the child is as likely to be right as he is; the parent's experience should be presumed to count for a lot.

headline.main: The Less Permissive Dr. Spock; The Less Permissive Dr. Spock

docs.abstract: K D Fishman article on Dr Spock's book on child care and changes since 1st ed in '46
